meanings.definition: A unit of weight for precious stones and pearls, equivalent to 200 milligrams.
meanings.sent1: She found a beautiful pearl that weighed one carate.
meanings.sent2: The diamond was so small, it only weighed half a carate.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally swallowed a carate, thinking it was a candy.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like a carate in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The carate of the gemstone made it incredibly valuable.

meanings.definition: A unit of purity for gold, with 24 carats being pure gold.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler confirmed that the necklace was made of 18 carate gold.
meanings.sent2: She inherited a ring made of 22 carate gold from her grandmother.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his teeth were as shiny as 24 carate gold.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a carate of gold.
meanings.sent5: The carate of the gold determined its value and shine.

meanings.definition: To estimate the value or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: She tried to carate the antique vase before selling it.
meanings.sent2: The appraiser will carate the painting to determine its worth.
meanings.sent3: He carated his collection of coins and was pleasantly surprised.
meanings.sent4: The teacher carated the students' essays with care.
meanings.sent5: Carating the vintage car was a challenging task for the expert.
